title: Cassiopeia's gameplay update
body:
So the gameplay update has been announced. Is there anywhere that non PBE players can talk about these changes to ask questions and voice concerns? Like one of my main issues right now is that a lot of people like to focus on Q damage however I have a different style and use Q and W to apply E (so I focus on E) but it seems like you're now forcing everyone into my playstyle which i'm not the biggest fan of (I like being unique! :( ). I'm also not a fan of you guys locking out CDR builds, free CDR is a very silly thing to give a champion because when all is said and done if you want a champion to have lower cooldowns, *just lower their cooldowns*, you guys thankfully realized this and removed it on Heimer (though Zyra still has it atm) so it's very disappointing to see it being tacked onto Cass.

It's also not clear what exactly has been changed to make E more reliable (is it what I've suggested in the past?) and imo Q's cast delay should be removed, you're trying to emphasize the speed boost it gives but having her stand still to get that boost makes no sense and just makes the act of chasing really clunky imo.

Overall i'm not flipping tables but I am a bit concerned and wary given I feel she's currently the best designed champion in the game and my #1 favorite champion.

replies.body: I am so sad about this. I play her jungle, and I play her as Desperada. The numbers and the new passive simply won't allow me to jungler her anymore, and my skin is completely different, and I don't like the direction they are taking it at all.

Cass is a DoT mage! I am almost enraged at how riot is gutting her. They are trying to make her a machine gun mage like a ryze 2.0! They are de-emphasizing what she is all about to make her more of an "ap carry."

To me, and I'm sure to a lot of ppl, cass has always been a dot mage that emphasized melting opponents(not bursting them down, not pelting them with mini-nukes) and sieging towers. Riot said that they want ziggs to be the main siege champ, but cass was a siege champ before ziggs was even released! Shouldn't she have priority over this gameplay space?

It frustrates me, first riot guts my old karma(who could wave clear like no other) and now they are gutting cass. It's like riot has a vendetta against any champ that can wave clear really well, except for ziggs.

I've always felt like cass's twin fang felt rather tacked on on her kit. It almost seemed like it didn't belong, but just barely fit with everything else. But now they want it to be her only source of dmg.

But riot's not gonna listen to us. No, they've already invested too much time and effort into these changes. There is no going back now, now that it's already hitting the pbe. At best, we'll get a few number tweaks. But the cass we all knew and loved for melting faces and being the dot queen is forever going to be a thing of the past.
I do understand that you dont like change and youd rather see only buffs across the table, but try to understand that every single rework has turned out to  be for the better of the champion

It doesn't help *anybody* throwing out blind condescending statements like what you've just done. -_- I want to discuss these changes and help push her into a healthy direction, I just don't agree that some of these changes need to happen (that 30% CDR should be scrapped outright so does that count as a nerf?). To be quite frank i'm of the opinion that she doesn't actually need major changes (except fixing E's unreliability coupled with whatever nerfs are appropriate thanks to the new reliability) so your jump to assuming I just want random buffs is unwarranted.

Removing cast time on q which gives movement speed is a huge and kinda random buff. The only abilities that have no cast time have their own justifications and are there for a reason. Cassio is a dot aoe mage and she hardly needs that much mobility.

Just keep in mind that Riot's version of this might make Cass see more play and be more reliable. I see how dedicated mains claim she doesnt need that much, but the truth is, right now she is an extremely niche champion with an outdated kit. I might get alot of hate for it, but pick rates dont lie.

She is definitively a niche champion but there is nothing wrong with that and her kit is in no way outdated, it is a very very strong kit that is very well designed.

I agree that no cast animation would be huge but i'm putting myself in Riot's shoes with how they appear to want you using Q for the MS boost rather than the damage. My argument is that if they want it used that way then having this movement focused spell result in Cass stand on the spot for a moment is silly (GP has the same issues with Raise Morale). I mean imagine if Kennen stopped for a moment everytime he used Lightning Rush. I'm not too fussed personally I just think that if they really want the spell used for movement then it should feel fluid in that usage.

"extremely" niche is the key word here. Meaning that she is an aoe dot mage that has a really hard time holding her own. Shifting her power towards Twin Fang and late game definetely gives her some reliability which is exacly what she needs. Points you've brough up are purely against change itself, because her gameplay and mechanics will remain the same, you will just build her different and probably max different skills. MOBAs are all about adjusting, because every aspect of them changes as the time goes on

That being said, her changes are not on the level of karma and all there is to do is to adjust your build and maxing skills. Chances are Cass will be more effective with it.

Except at the moment she's not anywhere near as effective. She got across the board nerfs with promises of a strong late game, but no ratio increases. Her early game was destroyed, her late game is gone. Her passive *almost* gets her twin fang back into line with old values (by the time she has 800 ap or so) and none of her other spells even approach where they were. The only real buff is the heal and mana refund on twin fang, and sorry to say that doesn't make up for gutting a champion. 

She has reduced burst, reduced sustained damage, 30% CDR that she doesn't need, in exchange for a slightly better time farming and staying in lane. Oh, and she moves faster if she can hit her even more delayed Qs now, and slows enemies more, how *dare* I forget.
Hey have you played her on pbe? I have

Yes, I have. She's a sad shell of what she used to be. Until she's maxed her passive and has at least 500 AP she can't even begin to scratch the surface on the damage she used to do. 

Do you have anything constructive to add to the thread or are you just sticking the the first half of your name?

Name's lame, I admit it. Name changes cost too much:(

Overall I like the power shift into her E, more move speed and stronger slow. With this you have even more reasons to stick to tear (which is the best choice on her anyway), get rylais, rabadon, cdr free build in general. Also I like the fact that she is more of a late game, I feel like we dont have enough late game mids.

But well, nothing Im gonna say could change your approach to it so lets just agree to disagree and be done with it

You cannot strand a champion on promises of a late game by completely removing their ability to be relevant in a lane. Ever the hardest of late game carries aren't this weak early on, and she's not even among the hardest of late game carries.

Sorry bud, but it looks like yer the only one. For a dot mage to focus all of yer dmg onto a machinegun spell is a red flag to me. This is cass, not ryze here. She has always been about siege warfar and melting ppl in teamfights. She had her reset mechanic on E as a form of offensive defense for when ppl get too close she can burn them down fast if her team can peel for her, or she gets a good ult off.

But now, her only option is to sit back and wait till someone gets locked down and pray to God she can burst them with her weaker kit, because .05 increase in her ap ratio is insignificant. Especially compared to the huge hit her q took

Also, I think riot has a distorted view as to what a real carry is. A carry is not a champ that can 1v5 the enemy team with tons of dmg. A carry is not a champ that simply deletes targets in team fights.

A carry is a champ that directs and controls a fight from start to finish. They out put significant dmg, don't get me wrong, but a real carry is a champ that can litterally put their team on their back and CARRY. The reason we have adc's is because they can do that. But the main reason an adc can carry isn't what they do in teamfights, it's what they do AFTER the team fight. -taking objectives- And old cass could do that, she could take jungle objectives just fine, but struggled to take towers cuz she was a mage, not an adc. But in exchange for not being able to take towers, she had great wave clear. She was able to siege towers down and stall out a game so that her team could get built, then win team fights with her huge aoe dmg and zone control.

She can't do any of this anymore. Her burn dmg from her spells is far to weak to reliably take jungle objectives like dragon and baron. She still has no means of taking towers. And now she can't even clear minion waves. How are you supposed to carry if you can't do anything that is required for carrying? If simply winning a team fight made you a carry, why isn't velkoz or viktor or annie or veigar considered carries? Because they are just dmg and cc. Their role is to win the team fight and let their carries play safe so that you can take an objective afterward.

Carrying is about objectives, not teamfights. End of story.

I would argue her clear was any great due to the fact that mages like ziggs exist that dont have to wait for dots to come into effect. I can hardly comment on cass strength, because matchmaking in pbe either gets me paired against levels 20 or plats. There is hardly a middle ground.

But its kinda strange, I didnt notice THAT big of a decay in her power

I'm hardly against change, I just don't think some of these changes are particularly good. The passive is overly mathy and pointless with damage nerfs across the board which are mostly compensated for by a random rabadon passive, cooldown nerfs to Q and W which are again compensated by a free 30% CDR that results in severely limiting item builds. Things like the mana return and spellvamp on E are alright ideas i'm willing to try out.

It's strange though that you speak of her as being a dot mage when these changes are specifically lowering her dot and focus everything into her E dps.

And again there's nothing wrong with being niche especially with so many champions out there. Sometimes there's a playstyle not everyone loves.

She IS a dot mage. And I hate that riot is trying to make her a ryze 2.0

read my above post if you want to know more, I just had my rant for the day.

I think she's a bit of both personally and one of the great things is that the player can choose her playstyle on focusing on poison DoT or E mininuke DPS based on your build (eg: for DoT's you'll be grabbing Liandri's/Rylai and for E DPS you'll be looking at more pure AP).

Looks like now you have to max E quickly for all ins.  I'm not against that, but it looks like at first glance that she's going to fall off after you do max it.  I'm also not sure how well the mana passive on her E is going to work out for it.

Her new passive is interesting depending on how it works.  The old one was a noob trap so I'm glad it's gone.  It's either going to be strong, assuming multiplicatively, or necessary for her to stay relevant because she is falling off hard after 8 or so.  Her other spells are losing damage for her new E.  

Also yes, it does look like she's now more utility than pure DPS, and this makes me a little sad.  I hope she keeps her role as highest DPS champ in the game after this is done.
the sad thing with new "e" is that he is better than the actual only at max upgrade >-<
I think a lot of the problems is all the free stats she's getting. I'm really not a fan of free stats as they lack any form of gameplay unless they're only available in windows like AS steroids.

This, so much this. Not only that, but she is paying for these free stats with the massive, and I mean massive, nerfs to the rest of her kit. She got only one small buff, and that was a .05 ratio buff on a rank 5 E. But don't forget her rank 5 E also lost 40 base dmg at the same time. So that means that at 400 ap, cass is doing 20 less dmg with her new E than her current one. She'd need 800 ap just to break even with her old E.

Not to mention they neutered her poison damage... 

Even with her new passive farmed to max she has difficulty staying up with her old self. If they want to hit her bases so hard and say "late game" they need to improve her ratios. Right now she's "No game."

Pretty much this. I like cass the way she is now. I don't understand why they feel compelled to gut her. The only reason I don't play her in ranked is because she needs to be peeled for, and in silver, you can't trust ppl to peel for you.

Also, the only advantage the new cass has that the old one doesn't is that with her 3 core items, old cass will have 390 ap(with runes and masteries) while the new cass will have 507 ap(with same runes and masteries) Her core items are liandries, rylais, and d cap.

With just those 3 items, you will be doing faaaaar less damage everywhere. Except your E will be hitting for about 50 points more dmg than on live. But that does not make up for the 100+ dmg you are losing on your q and w.
Yep, all about AP AP AP  now so you can pray your twin fang ends up comping the damage lost on Miasma and Noxious Blast by the time you have 375 stacks.. It's terrible.

I might flip a table.

After this, Cass might not be my favorite anymore. They're butchering a lot of what I loved about her with her lane bullying/passive and putting a lot of emphasis on the "reliability" that her E got. I remember when before they canned that Lee Sin rework how much they emphasized that useless "late game" attack speed buff to his passive and how underwhelming it was. It sounds like that, and I'm not excited.

I was praying this would never come. :(

One match in the PBE, and I already hate this new cass. Her poisons are the equivalent of getting hit with a wet noodle, and twin fang doesn't NEARLY make up for the massive amounts of lost damage. They really need to look at her more in depth because this isn't a gameplay update, it's an outright HARD nerf.
You can't really understand a champion fully with one match. Besides, PBE means number tweaks are likely.

Except I know where she was, and that she's nowhere near that. It's not a question, it's a fact. Her bases got nerfed, and no ratios added (except a very minor twin fang ratio increase) to support her new claim to late game fame. What they gave her does not equal what they took. 

Power was not taken from her early game, it was taken from her for the entirety of the match. She doesn't scale without ridiculous amounts of AP she can't get because her early game damage is non-existent. The damage of her poisons is at PBE values, completely negligible. Twin Fang is the only option to max, and even *it* doesn't match up to her live values without upwards of 800 ap. It got a base damage nerf as well, to accommodate all the other damage she lost. 

It really doesn't take a lot of time to see that something that was good is currently trash tier. I hope for Cassiopeia's sake they do some MAJOR number tweaking, because her current pbe state isn't worth playing.

It doesn't matter if you "know where she was." These are major changes and its going to take more than a single, solitary game to fully grasp where these changes left Cass. That goes for any champion changes. This is how science approaches it; would you trust a source that claimed to have improved a drug if they only tested one subject? No of course not. They don't have the amount of information required. 

I'm not saying you are wrong. I'm just saying that the proper amount of samples would give you a better informed opinion. Just because something initially seems bad doesn't mean it is. When Syndra was first released, I hardly saw anyone play her, but currently she is counted as a really strong AP burst champion. Sona is a recent example: I will be the first to admit I didn't like her changes, but after playing many games with her, I found her kit felt better than I expected. 

Speaking on Cass specifically: she now relies on a "stack" system to grow in strength. Most champions which rely on stacks to build them up tend to be really powerful later on in the game. Nasus comes to mind right away: be becomes a huge tank with the ability to rip through towers in a few auto attacks. Veigar is another good example. But instead of Cass just getting AP, she ALSO gets essentially spell vamp on her E, 30% CDR without items, and at full stacks she essentially has a Deathcap (30% AP added). Call me crazy, but that sounds like some pretty good late game potential. Of course, if she is too weak early and can't ever get to this potential, then that would be a major problem, I'll admit. But the basis for a really high DPS is there I think.

Cassiopea's playstyle was always to land W or Q (preferably Q, for maximum damage) and then spam E until the person died, refreshing Q and/or W as necessary. In fact, a full Cass combo (R+W+Q+several Es) would kill any squishy dead before the 2-second stun wore off.

I very much like this gameplay update. Anything that brings back Cass to relevance (and introduces diversity in the game by encouraging AP DPS instead of AP burst) is welcome.

My main interest at the moment is how this affects Cassiopea support (something I enjoy dabbling in). At first, I thought her passive was going to be useless, since supports shouldn't CS, but then I read that every second that a champion stays poisoned counts for her passive. This is excellent news for Cassiopea support. Her passive gives her an amazing kick that keeps her relevant even in late-game on a support's budget.

A potential build I am currently imagining would be Frost Queen's Claim, Ruby Sightstone, Mobility/Sorcerer's Boots, Rylai's Crystal Scepter, Mikael's Crucible and Locket of the Iron Solari. That would give her a significant degree of tankiness and roughly 200 AP (before passive). With a fully stacked passive, she'd be wasting her cooldown reduction, yes, but she can always sell her FQC for a Deathcap late-game (and supports tend to burn their CDR, given how many support items have that stat).

I am looking forward to trying her out in bot lane!

Current Cass is stronger as support...just because she brings soo much more base-dmg and the new passive only kicks in on really high  ap-values.
And her playstyle in clashes had been all about having high uptimes on q+w on the entire opponent team, nuking with e only for cleanup or if someone is out of position (otherwise youÂ´re a dead cassio really fast vs competent teams).

That's quite true, I agree that the new Cass won't have the early game pressure that she has now. However, I find it very interesting to have an AP support that continues to scale well into late game and whose damage doesn't fall off when she buys support items. It would be neat to see what new Cass can do by late game with a support's build.

I think Cass Support will get buffed with this, more utility in Q and W and free damage from the passive. The wasted CDR won't be fun though.

I disagree that Cass is irrelevant, I still play her and I still find that she's strong (barring the pain of E not resetting when it should).

And yeah her playstyle was always apply poison then spam E but Q and W always seemed like just enough to fall back on if things went wrong with E, now it feels like she's being pushed so that spamming E is the only thing she can do for damage. Though getting a better look at the numbers (this is why they need to show the changes, not just the new values) W didn't get hit as hard as I initially thought, not sure about Q though.

I'm not strictly opposed to the changes, i'm just concerned and wish to discuss them with the guy in charge (which sadly you can only do if you're privileged enough to have pbe access) because there are some aspects I am not a fan of (free CDR and I think if they want to emphasize Q's chasing potential the cast animation should be removed, it did wonders for Maokai).

I like the added utility on the W, since it actually helps someone other than yourself (the Q utility buff is largely useless to your ADC). Wasted CDR is the worst on supports, because even if you don't buy lucidity boots, you are still burning CDR by late game.

I don't think Cass is 100% completely irrelevant, but I do believe that she's not currently 100% relevant either. She's an immobile, close-to-mid-range squishy mage whose main source of CC is on a very long cooldown, which makes her easy prey for highly mobile opponents (particularly assassins). The current top-tier mages are either long-range (Xerath, Ziggs, Orianna), have a spammable form of hard cc (Syndra, Ahri, Xerath) or have a degree of mobility (Ahri, Ziggs). And they all have extremely fast wave-clear. I believe Cass may be up to par in terms of wave-clear, but perhaps she needs some AP before she can take out a whole wave with W and Q.

The wasted CDR is probably the only truly bad part of her kit. I feel something like 10% CDR would be fine. We don't need to overburn it when CDR is so ridiculously easy to get from items.

The damage reduction is actually a necessary part of the identity they want for Cassiopea. They don't want her to be a burst mage, but a late-game hypercarry, which means that having good base damages is counterproductive. Hypercarries are defined by their awful early game and their amazing scaling. This means that, much like Vayne, Tristana or Kog'maw, it's perfectly okay for Cassiopea to lose lane so long as her team can stall long enough for her to farm up her items and get a kill or two. If the enemy team can't push Cassiopea's disadvantage when she's at her weakest (early game) and finish before late-game rolls in, Cassiopea will easily wipe out teams like your average Vayne.

So basically, playing Cass will be a game of patience. You will suffer early game. You are likely to lose your tower. This is okay. Just bide your time, focus on CSing and get your big-ticket items. When late game comes in, let someone else initiate and then just drop a W on them and take them all out.

The CDR is really the only thing i'm truly against but a lot of these changes just make her look like she's going to become extremely binary and just an E bot. Q damage looks too low so it can't be used as a fallback if you goof E, there will be no build options for her anymore (wanna do something other than tear? TOO BAD! wanna go Morello's against Swain or Mundo? TOO BAD!) and all those free stats just simply don't add gameplay imo. The only times they do is when they're only available in windows like an AS steroid. If they want her E to hyperscale then just make her max rank ratio higher, it's easier to do and understand than giving her a free Rabadons to go alongside your purchased Rabadons, all it is is layer upon layer of maths. :S

It is generally a 'need to play to understand' situation (except the CDR, seriously for the love of god scrap it Riot Stashu!) but I am very concerned about what some of these changes are doing and how she's being shifted.

/edit

I just realized something. With free 30% CDR Cass will no longer be punished for screwing up E. Why in the world would they do that? :S

The more I think about it, the more she sounds like a "nasus like for mid" who gonna farm her passiv early game and rekt late game. (and it seems like Stashu want that as he point often this change of play during the game on the pbe thread)

We all know what weakness have that kind of champ, gank, gank and gank again to avoid them stacking and make them useless late game.

For top and bot champ it's still playable as they only have one danger zone next them, for a mid champ it sounds more like a death wish if your jungler doesn't help you to ward :s

Hopefully, she will become on the other hand a stupidly broken champ on aram with all the champ stack, beging for poison :p
I don't think Cass right now has any problem... If anything just fix E or Ulti.  Other than that, nothing else needs fixing...
